api.auth package

Submodules

api.auth.auth_db module

(module) auth_db

This contains functions related to the users db, This has the usernames and hashed passwords for oauth2 authentication

async api.auth.auth_db.create_database() → None[source]

Creates the users table Useful when you want to reset the users

async api.auth.auth_db.create_new_user(username: str, password: str, disabled: int = 1) → None[source]

Creates a new user in the db This is basically a new account to be used for the oauth2 authentication

:param : param: username (str) : The username for the account :param : param: password (str) : The password for the account (will be stored encrypted) :param : param: disabled (int, optional) : If the account is disabled or not (0 = False, 1 = True)

async api.auth.auth_db.get_all_users() → Optional[List[Tuple]][source]

Fetches all users from the database (Users table)

Returns

Optional[List[Tuple]]

async api.auth.auth_db.get_user(username: str) → Union[bool, api.auth.classes.UserInDB][source]

Gets a specific user from the Users table if not found it will return False

:param : param username (str) : The username to search for

Returns

Union[bool, DBUser]

api.auth.authenticate module

async api.auth.authenticate.get_current_active_user(current_user: api.auth.classes.User = Depends(get_current_user))[source]

Gets a user and checks if they are disabled

Returns

if not disabled it returns the User else it returns and raises an HTTPException

async api.auth.authenticate.get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer))[source]

Decrypts a token to extract the user info from it, then it fetches the correct user from the db If user doesnt exist or invalid token it returns and raises an HTTPException

:param token (str) : The users token

Returns

The user or it returns none and raises an exception

Return type

User

async api.auth.authenticate.login(form_data: fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType))[source]

Token endpoint - Login here and get your token

Username and Password are required and must be valid, if correct you will get youre beautiful token

Returns

Dict[str, str]

This is a database item. It usually takes in and asyncpg.Record class and makes it into a dataclass This is for simplicity because asyncpg.Record is a list and this is a class

api.auth.encryption module

async api.auth.encryption.decrypt_token(key: str, source: str) → str[source]

Decrypts an encrypted token into a username which will be used to get the user from the token

:param : param key (str) : The key that was used to encrypt the text, this will reverse it :param : param source (str) : The encrypted text you want to decrypt

Returns

Source but encrypted

Return type

str

async api.auth.encryption.encrypt_text(text: str) → str[source]

Encrypts text

:param : param text (str) : The text you want to encrypt

Returns

The hashed text

Return type

str

async api.auth.encryption.encrypt_token(key: str, source: str) → str[source]

Encrypts a text into an auth token
